===Overview===
The '''Persian Empire''' (Persian: شاهنشاهی ایران‎), was a state that controlled much of Western [[Asia]] and Balkans in [[Europe]] between the 6th century B.C. and the early 20th century. It's capital and cultural centre was [[Babylon]].

===Religion===
The Ancient Persians worshiped as gods powerful extradimensional humanoid beings known as the [[Yazatas]]. They lived in [[Zurvan]], a small "pocket dimension" adjacent to Earth. These beings helped the formed the Persian civilization.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Vol 1 5}}

===Events===
====Achaemenid Empire (550–330 B.C.)====
From 550 B.C., [[Darius (Persia) (Earth-616)|Darius the Great]], ruled the Empire for 36 years. The [[Eternals (Homo immortalis)|Eternal]]; [[Makkari (Earth-616)|Makkari]] was the charioteer of king Darius during this time.{{r|Thor & Hercules: Encyclopaedia Mythologica #1|; [[Makkari (Earth-616)|Makkari]]'s entry}}

In 481 B.C., [[Leonidas I (Earth-616)|King Leonidas]] and his [[Spartans]] battled the Persian Empire with odds and numbers against them.{{r|Black Sun: Wolverine and Thunderbird #1}}

In 330 B.C., [[Alexander the Great]] king of [[Macedonia]] aided the Egyptian in repelling Persian invaders bringing most of the region into the [[Macedonian Empire]].{{r|X-Men: The Search for Cyclops #1}}

====Sasanian Empire (224–651 A.D.)====
In 325 A.D., [[Sanjar Javeed (Earth-616)|Sanjar Javeed]] was born the illegitimate son of [[Shapur II (Earth-616)|King Shapur II]] of Persia.  Though his father was revered as beloved, generous, and compassionate, Sanjar never received these emotions from his father as he was born to a servant mother.  Attempting to gain the love of the people of Persia, Sanjar would steal treasures from his father and give them to the townsfolk. Unaware of his [[Homo superior|mutant]] ability to transmit terminal diseases, his gifts to the townsfolk only spread death, even killing his father.{{r|Uncanny X-Force #3}} Sanjar was watched by the eternal mutant [[En Sabah Nur (Earth-616)|Apocalypse]] and selected as his [[Horsemen of Apocalypse (Earth-616)|Final Horseman]] [[Death]] in the event that all other plans of Apocalypse failed.{{r|Uncanny X-Force #3}} 

In 750 A.D. [[Baghdad]], [[Abu Mūsā Jābir ibn Hayyān al-Azdi (Earth-616)|Jābir ibn Hayyān]], then-leader of the [[Brotherhood of the Shield (Earth-616)|Brotherhood of the Shield]], conceived of a way to keep the world from ever ending. He built a machine that would take the sum total of the hopes, dreams, inspirations and desires of a thousand men a give it to a single man. This man could then recreate the world whenever it was threatened. The machine, however, drained the men of their lifeforces and the machine failed.{{r|S.H.I.E.L.D. #3}}
